data.name: Organisation_CompleteAndShareSupplierInformation
data.value: Complete and share your supplier information to bid for procurements.

data.name: Organisation_WeCouldNotApproveYourRequest
data.value: We could not approve your request because:

data.name: Organisation_CreateApiKey
data.value: Create an API key and share it with the e-Sender you use to publish procurement notices.

data.name: Organisation_SupplyGoodsServices
data.value: If you also supply goods, works, services or utilities to the public sector.

data.name: Organisation_ProcurementPathwayService
data.value: Procurement Pathway service (opens in new tab)

data.name: Global_Email_Invalid_ErrorMessage
data.value: Enter an email address in the correct format, like name@example.com

data.name: Organisation_EnterOrganisationName_Buyer_Hint
data.value: If you’re a department, agency or public body on the GOV.UK organisations list (opens in a new tab), use the exact name shown. If not, use your full official name. For example, HM Revenue & Customs not HMRC.

data.name: Organisation_EnterOrganisationName_Supplier_Hint
data.value: As registered on Companies House if incorporated, or the trading name of the company.

data.name: Organisation_ChangeSignInDetails
data.value: You can change your sign in details in your GOV.UK One Login.

data.name: Organisation_RegisterOrganisation
data.value: Register an organisation if you are:

data.name: Organisation_ContractingAuthority
data.value: a contracting authority who publishes notices to buy goods, works, services or utilities

data.name: Organisation_OrganisationOrSoleTrader
data.value: an organisation or sole trader who searches for tenders and submits bids to supply goods, works, services or utilities

data.name: Organisation_IfYouNeedTo
data.value: If you need to you can:

data.name: Organisation_RegisterAsOtherRole
data.value: register as the other role, if you are both a buyer and supplier

data.name: Supplementary_PrivacyNotice_Title
data.value: Privacy notice: how we use your data

data.name: Supplementary_PrivacyNotice_Intro
data.value: GOV.UK Digital Service Platform is provided by Government Digital Service (GDS), which is part of the Cabinet Office. The data controller for GDS is the Cabinet Office. A data controller determines how and why personal data can be processed.

data.name: Supplementary_PrivacyNotice_ReadMore
data.value: Read the Cabinet Office’s entry in the Data Protection Public Register for more information.

data.name: Supplementary_PageNotFound_TypedAddress
data.value: If you typed the web address, check it is correct.

data.name: Supplementary_PageNotFound_PastedAddress
data.value: If you pasted the web address, check you copied the entire address.

data.name: Supplementary_Index_Title
data.value: Register your details as a buyer or supplier of procurements

data.name: Supplementary_Index_UnableToAuthenticate
data.value: Unable to authenticate user, please retry

data.name: Supplementary_Index_Intro
data.value: The Central Digital Platform (CDP) service is for both procurement professionals and suppliers in the UK's public and utilities sectors.

data.name: Supplementary_Index_UseService
data.value: Use the service if you are:

data.name: Supplementary_Index_ContractingAuthority
data.value: a contracting authority working in procurement who buys goods, works, and services, supplies them, or both

data.name: Supplementary_Index_Organisation
data.value: an organisation or sole trader who applies for contracts to supply goods, works, and services

data.name: Supplementary_Index_CreateLogin
data.value: You will need to create a GOV.UK One Login or sign in.

data.name: Supplementary_Index_AlreadyRegistered
data.value: If your organisation is already registered

data.name: Supplementary_Index_SignIn
data.value: You can sign in to your account.

data.name: Supplementary_Error_Title
data.value: Sorry, there is a problem with the service

data.name: Supplementary_ContactUs_SupportTeam
data.value: Our support team will contact you by email, Monday to Friday from 9am to 5pm, excluding bank holidays.

data.name: Supplementary_ContactUs_Message_ValidationErrorMessage
data.value: Message must be between 10 and 10,000 characters

data.name: Supplementary_ContactUs_Failure_Heading
data.value: There is a problem with the service

data.name: Supplementary_ContactUs_Failure_Description
data.value: Your message could not be sent. Try again or come back later.

data.name: Supplementary_CookieDetails_Title
data.value: Details about cookies on Find a Tender

data.name: Supplementary_CookieDetails_Intro
data.value: Find a Tender puts small files (known as ‘cookies’) onto your computer to collect information about how you browse the site. Find out more about the cookies we use, what they’re for and when they expire.

data.name: Supplementary_CookieDetails_GoogleAnalytics
data.value: We use Google Analytics software (Universal Analytics) to collect anonymised information about how you use Find a Tender. We do this to help make sure the site is meeting the needs of its users and to help us make improvements to the site.

data.name: Supplementary_CookieDetails_NoGoogleShare
data.value: We do not allow Google to use or share the data about how you use this site.

data.name: Supplementary_CookieDetails_ListItem1
data.value: how you got to the site

data.name: Supplementary_CookieDetails_ListItem2
data.value: the pages you visit on GOV.UK and how long you spend on them

data.name: Supplementary_CookieDetails_ListItem3
data.value: what you click on while you’re visiting the site

data.name: Supplementary_CookieDetails_ListItem4
data.value: Google Analytics sets the following cookies.

data.name: Supplementary_CookieDetails_SignedInInfo
data.value: When you sign in to the service, we’ll set cookies to keep you signed in as you use the site. These cookies do not store your personal data and are deleted when you close your browser.

data.name: Supplementary_CookieDetails_BannerInfo
data.value: You may see banners when you visit Find a Tender inviting you to select your cookie preferences. We’ll set cookies so that your computer knows you’ve seen such messages and not to show them again, and also to store your settings.

data.name: Supplementary_CookieDetails_ChangeSettingsInfo
data.value: You can change which cookies you're happy for us to use.

data.name: Supplementary_CookieDetails_TableRow_GA
data.value: This cookie is used with Google Universal Analytics. This cookie allows Google to track unique users via a client identifier that is randomly generated

data.name: Supplementary_CookieDetails_TableRow_GAT
data.value: This cookie is used with Google Universal Analytics. This cookie is used to monitor and track visitors’ behaviour on the site anonymously

data.name: Supplementary_CookieDetails_TableRow_GID
data.value: This cookie is used with Google Universal Analytics. This cookie is used to group the user behaviour

data.name: Supplementary_CookieDetails_TableRow_Antiforgery
data.value: This cookie keeps the service secure, preventing cross-site forgery requests.

data.name: Supplementary_CookieDetails_TableRow_Cookies
data.value: Stores details of the currently authenticated user.

data.name: Supplementary_CookieDetails_TableRow_Culture
data.value: Stores the currently selected language requirement.

data.name: Supplementary_Cookies_Intro1
data.value: Cookies are files saved on your phone, tablet or computer when you visit a website.

data.name: Supplementary_Cookies_Intro2
data.value: We use cookies to store information about how you use the Find a Tender website, such as the pages you visit.

data.name: Supplementary_Cookies_Settings_Intro
data.value: We use 2 types of cookie. You can choose which types you’re happy for us to use, except for those that are essential.

data.name: Supplementary_Cookies_GoogleAnalytics
data.value: We use Google Analytics to measure how you use the website so we can improve it based on user needs. We do not allow Google to use or share the data about how you use this site.

data.name: Supplementary_Cookies_GoogleAnalyticsInfo
data.value: Google Analytics sets cookies that store anonymised information about:

data.name: Supplementary_Cookies_ListItem1
data.value: how you got to the site

data.name: Supplementary_Cookies_ListItem2
data.value: the pages you visit on Find a Tender and how long you spend on each page

data.name: Supplementary_Cookies_ListItem3
data.value: what you click on while you’re visiting the site

data.name: Supplementary_Cookies_UseCookies
data.value: Use cookies that measure my website use

data.name: Supplementary_Cookies_DoNotUseCookies
data.value: Do not use cookies that measure my website use

data.name: Supplementary_Cookies_StrictlyNecessary_Info1
data.value: These essential cookies do things like remember when you are signed in, the language you want to view the site in, and the notifications you’ve seen so we do not show them to you again.

data.name: Supplementary_Cookies_StrictlyNecessary_Info2
data.value: They always need to be on.

data.name: Supplementary_Cookies_FindOutMore
data.value: Find out more about cookies on Find a Tender

data.name: Supplementary_Cookies_GovServices_Info
data.value: Most services we link to are run by different government departments, for example DWP’s Universal Credit online, DVLA’s vehicle tax service, or HMRC’s webchat. These services may set additional cookies and, if so, will have their own cookie policy and banner linking to it.

data.name: User_RemoveConfirmation_Title
data.value: Are you sure you want to remove {0}?

data.name: User_RemoveConfirmation_Header
data.value: Are you sure you want to remove [{0}]?

data.name: User_RemoveConfirmation_ConfirmValidation
data.value: Select yes to confirm remove user

data.name: User_UserSummary_HasPersonValidation
data.value: Select yes to add another user

data.name: Supplier_ConnectedEntity_Address_EnterRegisteredAddress_Hint
data.value: The address registered with Companies House, or the principal address the business conducts its activities. For example, a head office.

data.name: Supplier_ConnectedEntity_ConnectedEntityCompanyInsolvencyDate_Hint
data.value:
The date it stopped trading under its own name.

For example, 27 03 2007

data.name: Supplier_ConnectedEntity_ConnectedEntityCompanyInsolvencyDate_DateInFuture
data.value: Date of insolvency must be today or in the past

data.name: Supplier_ConnectedEntity_ConnectedEntityCompanyQuestion_Hint
data.value: Is the ‘connected person’ registered with Companies House as required by the Companies Act 2006.

data.name: Supplier_ConnectedEntity_ConnectedEntityControlCondition_Heading
data.value: Which specified conditions of control does {0} have?

data.name: Supplier_ConnectedEntity_ConnectedEntityControlCondition_Hint
data.value: As defined in part 1 schedule 1a of the Companies Act 2006. Select all that apply.

data.name: Supplier_ConnectedEntity_ConnectedEntityControlCondition_OwnsSharesHint
data.value: Directly or indirectly holds more than 25% of the company's shares

data.name: Supplier_ConnectedEntity_ConnectedEntityControlCondition_HasVotingRightsHint
data.value: Directly or indirectly holds more than 25% of the voting rights in the company

data.name: Supplier_ConnectedEntity_ConnectedEntityControlCondition_CanAppointOrRemoveDirectorsHint
data.value: Directly or indirectly holds the right to appoint or remove a majority of the company's board of directors

data.name: Supplier_ConnectedEntity_ConnectedEntityControlCondition_HasOtherSignificantInfluenceOrControlLabel
data.value: Has other significant influence or control

data.name: Supplier_ConnectedEntity_ConnectedEntityControlCondition_HasOtherSignificantInfluenceOrControlHint
data.value: Has the right to exercise, or exercises, significant influence or control over the company. As defined in the person of significant control (PSC) guidance.

data.name: Supplier_ConnectedEntity_ConnectedEntityDeclaration_Paragraph1
data.value: A ‘connected person’ is someone who influences or controls your company.

data.name: Supplier_ConnectedEntity_ConnectedEntityDeclaration_Paragraph2
data.value: It includes people with significant control (opens in new tab) and any other individual or company other than yourself that has a declarable interest in your organisation.

data.name: Supplier_ConnectedEntity_ConnectedEntityDeclaration_Paragraph3
data.value: For example, a director, a trust, a majority shareholder or a parent or subsidiary company.

data.name: Supplier_ConnectedEntity_ConnectedEntityDirectorResidency_Heading
data.value: What country does {0} usually live in?

data.name: Supplier_ConnectedEntity_ConnectedEntityCompanyRegisterName_Heading
data.value: Select where {0} is registered as person with significant control

data.name: Supplier_ConnectedEntity_ConnectedEntityCompanyRegisterName_CompaniesHouseOption
data.value: People with significant control register on Companies House

data.name: Supplier_ConnectedEntity_ConnectedEntityLawRegister_LegalFormationHint
data.value: When it was set up and registered, what structure was used. Also called trading status. For example, a limited company or limited liability partnership.

data.name: Supplier_ConnectedEntity_ConnectedEntityLegalFormQuestion_Hint
data.value: In the UK, this is a business structure or trading status. For example, limited company or limited liability partnership.

data.name: Supplier_ConnectedEntity_ConnectedEntityOrganisationCategory_PageTitle
data.value: Select the category that best describes the 'connected person'

data.name: Supplier_ConnectedEntity_ConnectedEntityOrganisationCategory_Hint
data.value: The ‘connected person’ that has control or influence over your organisation should fall into one of these categories.

data.name: Supplier_ConnectedEntity_ConnectedEntityOrganisationCategory_Option_Director
data.value: director or organisation with the same responsibilities

data.name: Supplier_ConnectedEntity_ConnectedEntityOrganisationCategory_Option_CompanyTakenOver
data.value: a company your organisation has taken over

data.name: Supplier_ConnectedEntity_ConnectedEntityOrganisationCategory_Option_OrgWithSignificantControl
data.value: any other organisation with significant influence or control

data.name: Supplier_ConnectedEntity_ConnectedEntityPostalSameAsRegisteredAddress_PageTitle
data.value: Does {0} have a different postal address?

data.name: Supplier_ConnectedEntity_ConnectedEntityPostalSameAsRegisteredAddress_Hint
data.value: The place where an organisation receives official post can be different from its registered address. For example, a branch office.

data.name: ShareYourInformation_HowItWorksParagraph1
data.value: To share your supplier information with buyers you need to create a share code and file, and declare that the information is correct.

data.name: ShareYourInformation_HowItWorksParagraph2
data.value: This saves a copy of the supplier information you provided about your organisation, connected persons, exclusions and financial information.

data.name: ShareYourInformation_HowItWorksParagraph3
data.value: When you submit a bid for a procurement, the contracting authority will let you know how to give them the share code or file.

data.name: ShareYourInformation_HowItWorksParagraph4
data.value: If your supplier information changes, you can update it and create a new share code and file to share the new information.

data.name: ShareYourInformation_Instructions
data.value: Create a share code once you've completed all sections. You'll be asked for this share code if you apply for a tender.

data.name: ShareYourInformation_TableCaption
data.value: Your share codes and supplier information files

data.name: ShareYourInformation_ShareCodeCreatedFooterBody1
data.value: You can save your share code and download your supplier information file or come back and get them when needed.

data.name: ShareYourInformation_ShareCodeCreatedFooterBody2
data.value: If your supplier information changes, you can update it and create a new share code and file to share the new information.

data.name: OrganisationRegistration_CompanyHouseNumberQuestion_Hint
data.value: You can find your company number on Companies House (opens in a new tab). It is an 8 digit or 2 letter and 6 digit number. For example, 12345678 or SC123456.

data.name: OrganisationRegistration_CompanyHouseNumberQuestion_CompanyNotFound_NotificationBanner
data.value: We cannot find your company number on Companies House. If it’s correct, continue and enter your details manually.

data.name: OrganisationRegistration_CompanyHouseNumberQuestion_CompanyAlreadyRegistered_NotificationBanner
data.value: An organisation with this company number already exists. Change the company number or request to join {organisationName}.

data.name: OrganisationRegistration_BuyerOrganisationType_CentralGovernment_Label
data.value: Central government, public authority: UK, Scottish, Welsh and Northern Irish Executive

data.name: OrganisationRegistration_BuyerOrganisationType_RegionalAndLocalGovernment_Label
data.value: Regional and local government, public authority: UK, Scottish, Welsh and Northern Irish

data.name: OrganisationRegistration_BuyerOrganisationType_CentralGovernment_Hint
data.value:
Includes arm's-length bodies:
  • executive agencies (EA)
  • non-departmental public bodies (NDPB)
  • non-ministerial departments (NMD)
  • Trading Funds

data.name: OrganisationRegistration_BuyerOrganisationType_RegionalAndLocalGovernment_Hint
data.value:
Includes:
  • unitary authorities
  • county, district, borough and parish councils
  • the Greater London Authority
  • charities
  • housing associations
  • blue light organisations - ambulance, police, and other emergency services

data.name: OrganisationRegistration_BuyerOrganisationType_PublicUndertaking_Hint
data.value: Unlike a public authority, organisations that operate commercially and provide utility activities to the public. For example, Transport for Wales.

data.name: OrganisationRegistration_BuyerOrganisationType_PrivateUtility_Hint
data.value: For example, private companies that have been granted a special or exclusive right to provide utility activities to the public. Such as National Grid or British Gas.

data.name: OrganisationRegistration_BuyerOrganisationType_Other_Hint
data.value: For example, the establishment of a utilities dynamic market by a non-contracting authority.

data.name: OrganisationRegistration_JoinOrganisationSuccess_Heading
data.value: Your request to join {0} has been sent

data.name: OrganisationRegistration_JoinOrganisationSuccess_Message
data.value: You'll receive an email about your request.

data.name: OrganisationRegistration_JoinOrganisation_ConfirmValidationErrorMessage
data.value: Select that you understand your name and email address will be shared

data.name: OrganisationRegistration_JoinOrganisation_AlreadyMemberOfOrganisation
data.value: You are already a member of this organisation. Go back to my account

data.name: OrganisationRegistration_JoinOrganisation_PendingMemberOfOrganisation
data.value: You have already requested to join this organisation. Your request is pending approval. Go back to my account

data.name: OrganisationRegistration_UserConfirm
data.value: I understand my name and email address will be shared with this organisation

data.name: OrganisationRegistration_OrganisationAlreadyRegistered_Message
data.value:
The organisation's details are already registered with the service.

If you know the person who registered the organisation, they can invite you to join. Or you can request to join below.

Request to Join

data.name: ApiKeyManagement_RevokeApiKey_Description1
data.value: Cancelling this API key will stop the sharing of information between this service and the eSender that's using it.

data.name: ApiKeyManagement_RevokeApiKey_Description2
data.value: You cannot re-activate a cancelled API key. You'll need to create a new one to share information again.

data.name: ApiKeyManagement_NewApiKeyDetails_CopyApiKey
data.value: Copy the API key and keep it safe.

data.name: ApiKeyManagement_NewApiKeyDetails_Notice
data.value: This is the only time we show you the API key. If you lose it, you’ll need to cancel it and create a new one.

data.name: ApiKeyManagement_ManageApiKey_NoKeysText
data.value: API keys that you create will be listed here.

data.name: ApiKeyManagement_ManageApiKey_Description
data.value: View your active and cancelled API keys.

data.name: ApiKeyManagement_ManageApiKey_Description_Editor
data.value: You can cancel any that are no longer needed.

data.name: ApiKeyManagement_CreateApiKey_Hint
data.value: For security we only show the API key once on the confirmation page. Add a name for reference. For example, the name of the eSender it's for.

data.name: Forms_FormElementFileUpload_DocumentsHint
data.value: You can upload most file types including: PDF, scans, mobile phone photos, Word, Excel and PowerPoint, multimedia and ZIP files that are smaller than 25MB.

data.name: Forms_FormElementMultiLineInput_CharacterCountMessage
data.value: You can enter up to 10,000 characters

data.name: Forms_FormElementCheckBoxInput_DeclarationRequiredError
data.value: You must agree to the declaration statements to proceed.

data.value: Day must be a valid number

data.name: Global_DateInput_MonthInvalidError
data.value: Month must be a valid number

data.name: Global_DateInput_YearInvalidError
data.value: Year must be a valid number

data.name: Global_DateInput_DateInvalidError
data.value: Date must be a real date

data.name: Global_DateInput_DateInFutureError
data.value: Date must be today or in the past

data.name: Forms_FormElementFileUpload_FileSizeExceededError
data.value: The file size must not exceed {0}MB.

data.name: Forms_FormElementFileUpload_InvalidFileExtensionError
data.value: Please upload a file which has one of the following extensions: {0}

data.name: Forms_FormElementMultiLineInput_AllInformationRequiredError
data.value: All information is required on this page

data.name: Forms_FormElementTextInput_InvalidEmailError
data.value: Enter an email address in the correct format, like name@example.com.

data.name: Forms_FormElementUrlInput_InvalidWebsiteAddressError
data.value: Website address must be in the correct format, like www.companyname.com

data.name: Forms_FormElementAddress_PostalOrZipCode_RequiredError
data.value: Enter your postal or zip code

data.name: Support_OrganisationApproval_ErrorMessage
data.value: Tell the user why you could not approve

data.name: Support_OrganisationApproval_ErrorMessage_Hint
data.value: For example, ‘You need to change the email address. The domain name in the organisation email address you gave us does not match the organisation name you want to register’.

data.name: Supplementary_CookieDetails_TableRow_Preferences
data.value: Stores the cookies accept / reject preference.

data.name: Exclusions_AddExclusionDeclaration_Title
data.value: Add any mandatory and discretionary exclusions

data.name: Exclusions_AddExclusionDeclaration_Paragraph1
data.value: You must tell us if there are any circumstances that may exclude you as a supplier from the procurement process because your organisation or a connected person committed an offence.

data.name: Exclusions_AddExclusionDeclaration_Paragraph2
data.value: Offences are listed as 'mandatory exclusion grounds' and 'discretionary exclusion grounds' in the Procurement Act 2023.

data.name: Exclusions_AddExclusionDeclaration_InsetText
data.value: If any exclusions apply to a person with significant control, such as a director or majority shareholder, make sure you have added them as a connected person.

data.name: Exclusions_AddExclusionDeclaration_Paragraph3
data.value: You'll need to provide details about each exclusion, such as where it happened and who it applies to and upload any supporting documents you may have.

data.name: Exclusions_AddExclusionDeclaration_MandatoryExclusionsIntro
data.value: Penalties and other events that may exclude you are:

data.name: Exclusions_AddExclusionDeclaration_MandatoryExclusions_Penalty1
data.value: adjustments for tax arrangements that are abusive

data.name: Exclusions_AddExclusionDeclaration_MandatoryExclusions_Penalty3
data.value: defeat in respect of notifiable tax arrangements

data.name: Exclusions_AddExclusionDeclaration_MandatoryExclusions_Penalty4
data.value: failure to cooperate with an investigation

data.name: Exclusions_AddExclusionDeclaration_MandatoryExclusions_Penalty5
data.value: finding by HMRC, in exercise of its powers in respect of VAT, of abusive practice

data.name: Exclusions_AddExclusionDeclaration_MandatoryExclusions_Penalty6
data.value: penalties for transactions connected with VAT fraud and evasion of tax or duty

data.name: Exclusions_AddExclusionDeclaration_MandatoryExclusions_Penalty7
data.value: penalties payable for errors in tax documentation and failure to notify, and certain VAT and excise wrongdoing

data.name: Exclusions_AddExclusionDeclaration_MandatoryConvictionsIntro
data.value: Convictions that may exclude you are:

data.name: Exclusions_AddExclusionDeclaration_MandatoryConvictions_Conviction1
data.value: ancillary offences - aiding, abetting, encouraging or assisting crime

data.name: Exclusions_AddExclusionDeclaration_MandatoryConvictions_Conviction4
data.value: labour market, slavery and human trafficking offences

data.name: Exclusions_AddExclusionDeclaration_MandatoryConvictions_Conviction7
data.value: terrorism and offences having a terrorist connection

data.name: Exclusions_AddExclusionDeclaration_MandatoryExclusionsLinkText
data.value: These exclusions are defined in schedule 6 of the Procurement Act 2023 (opens in new tab).

data.name: Exclusions_AddExclusionDeclaration_DiscretionaryExclusionsIntro
data.value: Discretionary exclusions that may exclude you are:

data.name: Exclusions_AddExclusionDeclaration_DiscretionaryExclusions_Exclusion2
data.value: breach of contract and poor performance

data.name: Exclusions_AddExclusionDeclaration_DiscretionaryExclusions_Exclusion4
data.value: infringement of Competition Act 1998, under Chapter II prohibition

data.name: Exclusions_AddExclusionDeclaration_DiscretionaryExclusions_Exclusion7
data.value: potential competition and competition law infringements

data.name: Exclusions_AddExclusionDeclaration_DiscretionaryExclusions_Exclusion9
data.value: suspension or ceasing to carry on all or a substantial part of a business

data.name: Exclusions_AddExclusionDeclaration_DiscretionaryExclusionsLinkText
data.value: These exclusions are defined in schedule 7 of the Procurement Act 2023 (opens in new tab).

data.name: Consortium_ConsortiumStart_Paragraph1
data.value: Two or more suppliers that want to submit a joint bid can create a consortium. You can add as many suppliers as you need to.

data.name: Consortium_ConsortiumStart_Paragraph2
data.value: As the organisation creating the consortium, you'll need to enter:

data.name: Consortium_ConsortiumStart_Paragraph2_list
data.value:
• a consortium name
  • an address
  • an email address
  • your most recent share code
  • the most recent share codes for all the other suppliers

data.name: Consortium_ConsortiumStart_Paragraph3
data.value: Any supplier you want to add to the consortium must have completed their supplier information and created a share code.

data.name: Consortium_ConsortiumStart_Paragraph4
data.value: When you've added all suppliers, you'll create a share code for your combined supplier information.

data.name: Consortium_ConsortiumName_Hint
data.value: You can change this later if you need to

data.name: Consortium_ConsortiumEmail_Heading
data.value: Enter an email address for the consortium

data.name: Consortium_ConsortiumAddress_Heading
data.value: Enter a postal address for the consortium

data.name: Consortium_ConsortiumAddress_NonUk_Heading
data.value: Enter a postal address for the consortium

data.name: Supplier_EmailAddress_Hint
data.value: It should be a shared inbox managed by your team, not your own email address. This will be displayed on notices.

data.name: Supplier_InformationHint
data.value: We need information from you based on the type of supplier you are.

data.name: Supplier_WhatTypeOfSupplier
data.value: What type of supplier are you?

data.name: Supplier_Individual
data.value: Individual - for example, a sole trader

data.name: Supplier_VatQuestion_VatNumberHint
data.value: You can find it on your VAT registration certificate.

data.name: Supplier_VatQuestion_BelongsToAnotherOrganisation_Error
data.value: This VAT number belongs to another organisation. Enter a different VAT number.

data.name: Supplier_WebsiteQuestion_ErrorInvalidUrl
data.value: Website address must be in the correct format, like https://www.companyname.com

data.name: Supplier_AddressPostalSameAsRegisteredQuestion_Title
data.value: Does your organisation have a different postal address?

data.name: Supplier_AddressPostalSameAsRegisteredQuestion_Hint
data.value: The place where an organisation receives official post can be different from its registered address. For example, a branch office.

data.name: Supplier_OperationQuestion_SmallAndMediumSized_Description
data.value: Small and medium-sized enterprises are defined by having:

data.name: Supplier_OperationQuestion_SmallAndMediumSized_Details
data.value:
(a) fewer than 250 staff, and

(b) a turnover of an amount less than or equal to £44 million, or a balance sheet total of an amount less than or equal to £38 million

data.name: Supplier_OperationQuestion_SupportedEmploymentProvider_Description
data.value: Supported employment providers are defined by having:

data.name: Supplier_OperationQuestion_SupportedEmploymentProvider_Details
data.value:
Wholly or partly provided employment, or employment related support, to disabled or disadvantaged individuals where:

(a) disabled or disadvantaged individuals represent at least 30 per cent of the workforce of the organisation,

(b) if a particular part of the organisation is to perform the contract, disabled or disadvantaged individuals represent at least 30 per cent of the workforce of that part of the organisation, or

(c) if more than one organisation is to perform the contract, disabled or disadvantaged individuals represent at least 30 per cent of the combined workforce of—

(i) those organisations,

(ii) where a particular part of each organisation is to perform the contract, those parts, or

(iii) where a combination of organisations and parts is to perform the contract, those organisations and parts.

data.name: Supplier_OperationQuestion_PublicService_Description
data.value: Public service mutuals are defined by having:

data.name: Supplier_OperationQuestion_PublicService_Details
data.value: Previously left the public sector but continues delivering public services.

data.name: Supplier_LegalFormCompanyActQuestion_Title
data.value: Is your organisation registered on Companies House?

data.name: Supplier_LegalFormCompanyActQuestion_Hint
data.value: As required by the Companies Act 2006.

data.name: Supplier_LegalFormFormationDate_Title
data.value: What is the equivalent date your company registered under the Companies Act 2006?

data.value: Date of registration must include a month

data.value: Month must be a valid number

data.name: Supplier_LegalFormFormationDate_YearErrorMessage

data.value: Year must be a valid number

data.value: Date of registration must be a real date

data.name: Supplier_LegalFormFormationDate_FutureDateErrorMessage

data.name: MoU_ReviewAndSignComplete_Hint
data.value: We’ll email a copy of the agreement to you.

data.name: MoU_ReviewAndSignComplete_Title
data.value: You've signed the data sharing agreement

data.name: MoU_ReviewAndSign_ConfirmStatement
data.value: I am authorised to sign the agreement for my organisation on behalf of:

data.name: MoU_ReviewAndSign_Confirm_Title
data.value: I confirm that I have read and agree to the data sharing agreement

data.name: MoU_ReviewAndSign_Hint
data.value: The data sharing agreement is a memorandum of understanding (MoU) between the Cabinet Office and contracting authorities as joint data controllers of the personal and sensitive data collected and shared on the Find a Tender service.

data.name: MoU_ReviewAndSign_SelectCheckbox_ErrorMessage
data.value: Please tick the checkbox, if you have read and agree to the data sharing agreement

data.name: MoU_ReviewAndSign_Warning
data.value: You must sign the MoU before you can use the service. It is a formal agreement between the Cabinet Office and your organisation.

data.name: OrganisationOverView_Banner_PendingApproval
data.value: we need to approve your organisation. We'll email you, usually within one working day.

data.name: OrganisationOverView_Banner_PendingApproval_Hint
data.value: Before you can use this service:

data.name: OrganisationOverView_Banner_Review_MoU_Link
